results.1-1: Accomplish incomprehensible plans that lead it to act in seemingly random ways.
results.2-2: Learn more of the world by kidnapping people and consuming their minds.
results.3-3: Manipulate innocents into worshiping it as a god by using its telepathy from hiding.
results.4-4: Open a gate to the distant past or future, releasing an invasion from another time.
results.5-5: Rouse a dragon turtle, a kraken, or another sea monster to flood a coastal city.
results.6-6: Trick treasure hunters into recovering relics from its long-fallen empire.

results.1-1: Cumulus or cirrus clouds.
results.2-2: A mixture of vibrantly colored gases.
results.3-3: A pungent, sour-looking miasma
results.4-4: Shifting cloud clusters that resemble animals and simple shapes.
results.5-5: Sinister features obscured in a misty mass.
results.6-6: Swirling storm clouds.

results.1-1: A Celestial or Fiend using the object to protect or torment a mortal.
results.2-2: A combination of magic and technology, such as alchemy or alien science.
results.3-3: The essence of someone transformed by a supernatural trickster.
results.4-4: Fey as part of their games or wiles.
results.5-5: A magic-user in need of a guardian or servant.
results.6-6: Happenstance, with the item gaining a semblance of life after a hundred years of use.
results.7-7: The song of a magical instrument.
results.8-8: A spirit possessing the object.
results.9-9: Wild magic, a spell that went awry, or a chaotic Artifact.
results.10-10: The will of a powerful psychic being.

results.1-1: Another tunnel (either natural or of worked stone) that extends into the Underdark.
results.2-2: A buried ruin or grave exposed by the tunnel.
results.3-3: A cluster of 1d4 fresh ankheg eggs that can be broken and used as vials of Acid.
results.4-4: A dead ankheg and evidence of a deadlier subterranean predator.
results.5-5: A piece of ankheg carapace usable as a Shield.
results.6-6: A pouch with 2d6 GP near a puddle of acid.
results.7-7: A stray farm or woodland animal.
results.8-8: A viciously mauled scarecrow.

results.1-1: The bones of the arch-hag’s first love.
results.2-2: A devil’s tear.
results.3-3: An egg with a miniature castle inside.
results.4-4: A flower that blooms only when time stops.
results.5-5: A gift from the hag’s twin.
results.6-6: The multiverse’s worst pun.
results.7-7: One of the hag’s missing teeth.
results.8-8: Snow from the top of Mount Celestia.
results.9-9: A star pulled from the sky.
results.10-10: A thread from the Lady of Pain’s robes.

results.1-1: Arranging their victims in artful tableaux.
results.2-2: Hiding within large objects, such as suits of armor or hollow furnishings.
results.3-3: Leaving behind a signature item, such as a calling card, flower, seashell, or tooth.
results.4-4: Posing as celebrities, holy people, or servants.
results.5-5: Taking trophies from their victims.
results.6-6: Using poison with a distinctive color or smell.

results.1-1: Fights only oppressors.
results.2-2: Is an ex-soldier who was discarded by their nation and now takes what they were promised.
results.3-3: Is in a gang that views nonmembers as foes.
results.4-4: Hesitantly serves a villainous leader.
results.5-5: Secretly works for a government or a regional ruler to sow chaos.
results.6-6: Takes what they need to survive.

results.1-1: Appear prior to a family member’s death.
results.2-2: Haunt the site where it was executed.
results.3-3: Lament a lost love and haunt their grave.
results.4-4: Presage a disaster or tragedy.
results.5-5: Seek the return of a stolen treasure.
results.6-6: Slay those more beautiful than it was in life.

results.1-1: An ancient black dragon’s acidic saliva.
results.2-2: The blood or extreme emotions of a foul deity.
results.3-3: Cosmic entropy or ruinous planar forces.
results.4-4: A curse that transformed a forgotten tyrant.
results.5-5: Forbidden or industrialized magic.
results.6-6: Necrotic material animated by aimless spirits.

results.1-1: An Amulet of the Planes.
results.2-2: An Artifact of the DM’s choice.
results.3-3: The corpses of two gods who were entangled in battle when the blob consumed them.
results.4-4: A Cubic Gate.
results.5-5: A Deck of Many Things.
results.6-6: A magic key that opens a door in Sigil that no other key and no spell can open.
results.7-7: The preserved corpse of an empyrean.
results.8-8: The remains of half a kraken.
results.9-9: The skull of a death god.

results.1-1: Capture a soul that escaped the Nine Hells.
results.2-2: Convey a message or make an example of someone in the name of an archdevil.
results.3-3: Find someone who broke a deal with a devil.
results.4-4: Slay someone or steal something as part of its pact with a wicked magic-user.

results.1-1: Being possessed by a fiendish being.
results.2-2: Being resurrected by an evil magic-user.
results.3-3: Lengthy exposure to a Lower Plane.
results.4-4: Making a bargain with a Fiend.
results.5-5: Suffering a god’s curse.
results.6-6: Taking part in fiendish rituals.

Chain Devil Masks.name: Chain Devil Masks
Chain Devil Masks.description: To a Viewer, the Chain Devil Looks Like …

results.1-1: The corpse of a loved one.
results.2-2: A disapproving deity.
results.3-3: A harsh instructor or superior.
results.4-4: The viewer at their lowest point in life.

results.1-1: Block the path of anyone who enters a site with a weapon drawn.
results.2-2: Defend any member of their creator’s family or community who is threatened in its sight.
results.3-3: Prevent any Fiend from crossing a bridge.
results.4-4: Remove any who enter its creator’s workshop.

results.1-1: The symbol is an alchemical sign
results.2-2: The symbol is an animal
results.3-3: The symbol is a celestial body
results.4-4: The symbol is a deity’s icon
results.5-5: The symbol is an element
results.6-6: The symbol is an eye
results.7-7: The symbol is a geometric shape
results.8-8: The symbol is a letter or number
results.9-9: The symbol is part of a monster

results.1-1: Depicted as A calendar or map
results.2-2: Depicted as A crest or as heraldry
results.3-3: Depicted as An elaborate diagram
results.4-4: Depicted as A metaphorical image
results.5-5: Depicted as A mystical being
results.6-6: Depicted as Part of an equation
results.7-7: Depicted as A repeating pattern
results.8-8: Depicted as A series of scratches

results.1-1: Bring about the end of a dominant order, an age, or the world.
results.2-2: Expand their faith though mind control or supernatural coercion.
results.3-3: Burn away the comfortable lies of reality, revealing forgotten or terrible truths.
results.4-4: Make global changes, like sinking the land or awakening volcanoes.
results.5-5: Remake life on a mass scale, altering other creatures’ bodies or spiritual beings.
results.6-6: Summon their deity or its herald, weapon, or realm into their world.

results.1-1: Marks from canine jaws to appear on the victim’s body, as if they were still being mauled.
results.2-2: The victim’s body to wither, as if constantly exposed to desert heat.
results.3-3: The victim to be distracted by distant howling or vague whispers only they can hear.
results.4-4: The victim’s flesh to rot like a corpse.
results.5-5: The victim to itch, as if they had fleas or sand beneath their skin.
results.6-6: Wicked symbols to gradually appear on and spread across the victim’s body.

results.1-1: Break open a vault and steal what’s within.
results.2-2: Defile a place using blasphemous symbols and demonic gore.
results.3-3: Fetch or otherwise provide materials for a profane ritual.
results.4-4: Guard a site and slay anyone who comes near.
results.5-5: Hunt down a foe, destroying everything barring the demon’s path.
results.6-6: Intimidate someone into following orders.

Deva Messages.name: Deva Messages
Deva Messages.description: The Deva Tasks a Mortal with Delivering …

results.1-1: The corpse of a hero in need of redemption.
results.2-2: The cure for a plague in a distant land.
results.3-3: A holy coffer that must not be opened.
results.4-4: A magic weapon usable only by a true hero.
results.5-5: A seedling that wilts if exposed to anger.
results.6-6: Someone from another world with a prophesied purpose but no memory.

results.1-1: Cause chaos within the temple of a deity that cursed it to live without a true form.
results.2-2: Conceal evidence of a vast conspiracy.
results.3-3: Control a community through fear by posing as a legendary bogeyman.
results.4-4: Replace a noble to enjoy a decadent lifestyle.
results.5-5: Spy on wizards to learn how to complete its own botched magical creation.
results.6-6: Take an influential position, acting as a sleeper agent for a doppelganger invasion.

Dracolich Soul Gem Vessels.name: Dracolich Soul Gem Vessels
Dracolich Soul Gem Vessels.description: A Dracolich’s Soul Gem Is Hidden In …

results.1-1: Another dragon’s treasure hoard.
results.2-2: The body of a servant or an ancestor.
results.3-3: The core of a dracolich’s melted hoard.
results.4-4: A corrupted dragon egg.
results.5-5: A dragon horn a hero took as a trophy.
results.6-6: A nation’s royal or religious treasure.
results.7-7: A powerful magic item.
results.8-8: A source of magical wonders, such as a giant tree or mystical pool.
results.9-9: The vault of an archdevil, a wicked god, or another extraplanar villain.
results.10-10: The weapon that slew the dracolich.

results.1-1: A blessing from a deity of assassins, dangerous wildernesses, or the Underdark.
results.2-2: A curse from a powerful hag, vengeful witch, or strange Artifact.
results.3-3: An experiment by an aboleth, a mind flayer, or another life-shaping magic-user.
results.4-4: A magical means of escaping disaster or some worse fate.
results.5-5: A mutation after exposure to chaotic planar energies or strange Underdark radiations.
results.6-6: A punishment from a spiteful god, like Lolth or the Queen of Air and Darkness.

results.1-1: An avenger who strikes against destructive civilizations and those who abuse nature.
results.2-2: A guide who aids travelers in navigating the realms of Beasts, Fey, or Plants.
results.3-3: A hermit who works alone to protect the lands, seas, or skies they call home.
results.4-4: A mender who travels the world healing natural, magical, or manufactured disasters.
results.5-5: Part of a loose organization that adheres to timeless rituals and guards natural secrets.
results.6-6: A warden who minds the underpinnings of reality and protects against extraplanar threats.

results.1-1: An acres-large clonal colony—a stand of identical, interconnected trees.
results.2-2: A fortresslike tree, like a baobab or sequoia.
results.3-3: A living lock—a plant that seals evil below or blocks the path to a dungeon.
results.4-4: A lonely tree that stands atop a windswept mountain or amid a petrified forest.
results.5-5: A plant with magic fruit or remarkable seeds.
results.6-6: A shambling mound or treant that the dryad lives in or around as a Fey symbiote.

results.1-1: Colorful mineral formations.
results.2-2: Cooled magma in melted heaps.
results.3-3: Grass, moss, or plant roots.
results.4-4: Heaps of peat or decaying matter.
results.5-5: Mounds of sand studded with shells.
results.6-6: Rubble or pieces of a ruined structure.
results.7-7: Striking striations or bands of color.
results.8-8: Veins of iron or other ore.

results.1-1: Dramatic increase or decrease in temperature.
results.2-2: Gigantic coral reef or fungal forest.
results.3-3: Never-ending storm or whirlpool.
results.4-4: Passage to the Underdark or portal to an Elemental Plane.
results.5-5: Primeval or previously extinct animal population.
results.6-6: Rapidly growing rainforest.
results.7-7: River where previously there was none.
results.8-8: Series of dramatic rock formations.

results.1-1: Balanced, naturalistic, or suggestive of watching eyes.
results.2-2: Colorful, shadowy, or fluid or that vary depending on the viewer.
results.3-3: Comforting and gentle or that remind viewers of pleasant memories.
results.4-4: Disconnected parts, visible thoughts, or errant shapes.
results.5-5: Machinelike, stoic, symmetrical, or suggestive of judgment.
results.6-6: Morbid, menacing, or monstrous or that embody the viewer’s fears.

results.1-1: Amping up one another in preparation for a conflict or challenge.
results.2-2: Arguing over plans for battle, dinner, or how to spend the day.
results.3-3: Criticizing one another as they perform separate tasks.
results.4-4: Engaged in a staring contest.
results.5-5: Making polite small talk as if they were meeting for the first time.
results.6-6: Performatively ignoring one another.
results.7-7: Talking over an increasingly convoluted plot.
results.8-8: Trying to keep one another awake.

results.1-1: Colorful, superheated gases.
results.2-2: A column of diabolical or divine flame.
results.3-3: Crackling shapes that look like animals, fiends, skeletons, sprites, or other beings.
results.4-4: Flames that are predominantly white, blue, or a more unusual color.
results.5-5: The form of a calm or tormented humanoid.
results.6-6: Smoke that forms eerie shapes or symbols.
results.7-7: Soot that smells like cedar, cloves, incense, or burning meat.
results.8-8: Swirls of cinders and burning debris.

results.1-1: Arcane diagrams etched into it.
results.2-2: Flames like dramatic features, horns, or hair.
results.3-3: Fractured pieces that fly in unison.
results.4-4: An iron plate bolted over its mouth.
results.5-5: Lethal head trauma.
results.6-6: Mismatched animal teeth.

results.1-1: Animal parts among its humanlike pieces.
results.2-2: A disguise of makeup and heavy clothing.
results.3-3: Missing parts and exposed insides.
results.4-4: Parts serving unintended roles, like a body composed of dozens of hands.
results.5-5: Perfect features accented by beautiful stitching.
results.6-6: Visible mechanisms, bellows, and engines.

results.1-1: Cooking a meal of Underdark delicacies.
results.2-2: Performing a psychic song or “smell poem.”
results.3-3: Recovering and nursing fallen adventurers.
results.4-4: Revealing the location of helpful magic items.
results.5-5: Serving as a guide to a foe’s hidden lair.
results.6-6: Sharing excessive encouragement and praise.

results.1-1: Chest or recently trapped mimic.
results.2-2: Collection of bubbles or rocks resembling eyes.
results.3-3: Key to a nearby door or coffer.
results.4-4: Remarkable weapon in need of repair.
results.5-5: Skeleton belonging to a famous adventurer.
results.6-6: Tablet bearing a mysterious message.

results.1-1: Another creature warped by dangerous magic.
results.2-2: The autonomous appendage of a chaotic deity, Far Realm entity, or star-spawn horror.
results.3-3: The experiment of an aberrant manipulator.
results.4-4: Part of the life cycle of some other Aberration.
results.5-5: A shape-shifter that lost control of its powers.
results.6-6: Someone cursed by a cult or vengeful deity.

results.1-1: Called on to deliver a message or mysterious parcel to or from Vlaakith the Lich Queen.
results.2-2: Encouraged by a disguised intellect devourer to seek out an elusive gith leader.
results.3-3: Entreated to aid githzerai fleeing the githyanki who destroyed their sanctuary.
results.4-4: Entrusted with renewing or disrupting the githyanki’s alliance with red dragons.
results.5-5: Invited to hunt illithids with githyanki.
results.6-6: Pressed to uncover a gith spy in a planar community or on a spelljamming ship.
results.7-7: Sent on a quest to discover the last known location of the hero Gith or Zerthimon.
results.8-8: Tasked with returning the blade of a fallen githyanki knight to the knight’s people.

results.1-1: Dedicates their impending victory to a deity, ruler, beloved noble, or member of the crowd.
results.2-2: Dresses in a monster-themed mask and cape.
results.3-3: Judges whether their foe fights honorably.
results.4-4: Leads the crowd in a rousing theme song.
results.5-5: Seeks to claim a trophy from a foe.
results.6-6: Takes advice from the crowd, omens, or a pet.

results.1-1: Cast a particular spell in the gorgon’s presence.
results.2-2: Keep their back to the gorgon or otherwise act like they don’t see the monster.
results.3-3: Offer it a drink of blood, water, or wine.
results.4-4: Recite a specific rhyme or sing a certain song.
results.5-5: Say its creator’s name backward.
results.6-6: Wear a mask, perhaps in the shape of a bull or an animal meaningful to the gorgon’s creator.

results.1-1: A bargainer’s memories of a loved one.
results.2-2: The cauldron of a rival hag.
results.3-3: A favor to be redeemed when the hag wishes.
results.4-4: A flower from a hidden Feywild garden.
results.5-5: A gift given freely by a yugoloth.
results.6-6: A vial filled with a ruler’s tears.

results.1-1: Advanced viruses, each the clone of all other grell. They exist only to feed and spread.
results.2-2: The larvae of another creature and require electrically charged environs to reproduce.
results.3-3: Seeking to escape some catastrophe or terror lurking in the depths.
results.4-4: Supernaturally connected to ravenous alien beings and serve as their feeding appendages.
results.5-5: Vestiges of an ancient evil that will return if grells collectively consume enough creatures.
results.6-6: Without souls, but convinced they can attain souls by eating certain beings.

results.1-1: Attack anything in the skies near their lairs.
results.2-2: Curse their killers. Those who slay a griffon face the enmity of all animals.
results.3-3: Lay eggs with remarkable healing properties.
results.4-4: Prefer the taste of horses over all other prey.
results.5-5: Serve the first creature they see after hatching.
results.6-6: Won’t attack those with royal blood.

results.1-1: Carving caves to serve as illithid outposts.
results.2-2: Hiding the threat of mind flayers beneath fake, purposefully crude dwellings.
results.3-3: Pretending to be helpful and luring travelers into false senses of security.
results.4-4: Raiding surface communities and tempting other creatures to pursue it into illithid traps.

results.1-1: The last words of an ancient sage or leader.
results.2-2: The location of a hidden city or continent.
results.3-3: A magic word, password, or riddle’s answer.
results.4-4: The names of all who have told it stories.
results.5-5: An otherwise forgotten ritual or spell.
results.6-6: Recipes using regional ingredients.
results.7-7: Stories of forgotten gods and local spirits.
results.8-8: The vulnerabilities of a legendary monster.

results.1-1: Carry its master’s palanquin through the air.
results.2-2: Defend a remarkable treasure or piece of armor by incorporating the item into its being.
results.3-3: Imitate a dead or imprisoned hero by using their armor and weapons.
results.4-4: Perform as a laborer or servant.
results.5-5: Serve in a legion formed from the armors of a land’s ancient defenders.
results.6-6: Stand sentry in a gallery of mundane armors.

results.1-1: Low-hanging moon, star, or other solar body.
results.2-2: Magical garden on a floating island.
results.3-3: Mountaintop with a view of a giant geoglyph.
results.4-4: Nest full of hippogriff eggs atop a spire.
results.5-5: Portal to the Feywild or an Upper Plane.

results.1-1: Build a vessel to carry hobgoblin armies to new conquests.
results.2-2: Capture monsters and train them to fight.

results.1-1: Bat-like with tattered wings.

results.3-3: Marked with its creator’s symbol.

results.1-1: Ensure none claim the weapon of a fallen hero.

results.1-1: An angry family member or authority figure.
results.2-2: Being chased through the wilderness.
results.3-3: Being devoured by animals or monsters.

results.1-1: Block a door that has never been opened, moving only when a prophecy is fulfilled.
results.2-2: Exhale poison gas whenever it can, pausing only when someone speaks a passphrase.
results.3-3: Pose as a statue until a community’s hour of greatest need.
results.4-4: Stand atop the resting place of a powerful magic item.

results.1-1: Guiding them into wildernesses, then abandoning them.
results.2-2: Mapping a shortcut through a monster’s lair.
results.3-3: Putting them to sleep, then stealing mounts or supplies.
results.4-4: Sharing the location of hidden treasure, which turns out to be sunlight on sand or water.

results.1-1: Abducts the vessel of a leader or another important community member.

results.6-6: Dams a river or cuts off a city’s sea access.

results.8-8: Masterminds an invasion from the sea by merfolk, sahuagin, or storm giants.

results.2-2: A contract folded into a paper figure.
results.3-3: The first magic item the lich created.
results.4-4: A hollow figurine of a deity or monster.
results.5-5: An hourglass with its sands floating in stasis.
results.6-6: A locket or signet ring with a noble crest.
results.7-7: A rune-etched egg.
results.8-8: The skull of the lich’s mentor.

results.1-1: An astronomer who draws magic from stars.
results.2-2: An author who writes about the occult.
results.3-3: A magical engineer who creates wonders.
results.4-4: An oracle who interprets omens.
results.5-5: A prodigy with a remarkable magical heritage.
results.6-6: A psion whose powers manifest as spells.
results.7-7: A scholar investigating ancient lore.
results.8-8: A soothsayer who advises rulers.
results.9-9: A war mage who aids soldiers in battle.
results.10-10: A witch who shares secret wisdom.

results.1-1: Attack a particular foe.
results.2-2: Create a distraction.
results.3-3: Give up a captive or corpse.
results.4-4: Let a group navigate its territory unharmed.
results.5-5: Let someone pretend to slay it in battle.
results.6-6: Scare or threaten someone.
results.7-7: Serve a creature as a steed until the sun sets.
results.8-8: Try to locate something from its vantage point in the sky.

results.1-1: Born a medusa and lives unaware of whatever curse or circumstances afflicted its ancestor.
results.2-2: Created by a god and tasked with guarding a treasure or secret.
results.3-3: A cultist who made a fiendish bargain and enjoyed rewards that have since faded.
results.4-4: An explorer transformed and compelled to defend a cursed ruin.
results.5-5: A vain noble whose magical attempt to gain eternal beauty backfired.
results.6-6: The victim of a bite from a magical serpent or reptilian god in disguise.

results.1-1: Access to a planar portal.
results.2-2: Information valued by its true master.
results.3-3: A lair where it can bring others of its kind.
results.4-4: Magic weapons or armor.
results.5-5: The right to loot holy sites in places it conquers.
results.6-6: Souls, whether as larvae or captured spirits.

results.1-1: Blot out the sun so their Underdark-dwelling servants can invade the surface.
results.2-2: Create a new monstrous fusion between mind flayers and a legendary monster.
results.3-3: Forge a psionic network uniting illithid colonies.
results.4-4: Replace world leaders with intellect devourers.
results.5-5: Restore a vessel to travel through Wildspace.
results.6-6: Sacrifice the mental energy of a planet’s populace to take control of a githyanki bastion.

results.1-1: A multilevel mine or sewer.
results.2-2: Multiple mazes connected by magic portals.
results.3-3: A poisonous swamp with labyrinthine paths.
results.4-4: The ruins of a buried palace or temple.

results.1-1: Create a clockwork outpost to monitor the balance of obscure planar forces.
results.2-2: Ensure neither side gains the upper hand in a conflict between good and evil.
results.3-3: Excavate a portal to another plane.
results.4-4: Find a lost contingent of modrons.
results.5-5: Reactivate a titanic but lost modron device.
results.6-6: Remove a forest, mountain, or city before the arrival of a modron procession.
results.7-7: Seal off a planar rift or wild magic zone.
results.8-8: Wage war with demons, slaadi, or chaotic Fey.

results.1-1: Open a portal to the past, when its power was at its height.
results.2-2: Perform a ritual that can be attempted only once every eight hundred years.
results.3-3: Reclaim and resurrect a loved one’s corpse.
results.4-4: Reconquer the lands that once composed its empire.
results.5-5: Recover the pieces of its lost heart.
results.6-6: Replace its descendant as the ruler of a realm.
results.7-7: Sacrifice a thousand souls to its god in return for true life.
results.8-8: Transform the people of an entire nation into Undead servants.

results.1-1: Defend a holy site it was created to protect.
results.2-2: Obey the summons of a mummy lord.
results.3-3: Oppose an enemy who has returned to life.
results.4-4: Protect its descendants from an ancient threat.
results.5-5: Punish the progeny of those who cursed it.
results.6-6: Reclaim treasures robbed from its crypt.
results.7-7: Serve whoever speaks the prayer on its tomb.
results.8-8: Slay anyone who sets eyes on it.

results.1-1: The champion or messenger of an evil deity.
results.2-2: A group of joyriding imps or quasits.
results.3-3: An innocent soul trapped on the wild Fiend.
results.4-4: A lore-hunting mage, cultist, or lich.
results.5-5: A night hag herding larvae between planes.
results.6-6: A wicked cavalier, such as a death knight, an erinyes, an incubus, or a vampire.

Ochre Jelly Leftovers.name: Ochre Jelly Leftovers
Ochre Jelly Leftovers.description: After a Meal, the Ochre Jelly Leaves Behind …

results.1-1: A bone etched with a word or an eerie symbol.
results.2-2: Broken dragonborn or tiefling horns.
results.3-3: An ornate prosthetic limb.
results.4-4: The skeleton of an explorer’s pet (perhaps a small dog, monkey, or parrot).
results.5-5: A skull with gold teeth worth 1d4 GP.
results.6-6: A spotless suit of metal armor.

results.1-1: Charming people to perform nasty tricks.
results.2-2: Claiming a bridge, gate, shrine, or trail and trying to eat anyone who comes near.
results.3-3: Luring other monsters to the settlement.
results.4-4: Playing drums that keep everyone awake.

results.1-1: Disguises its tentacles with garbage puppets.
results.2-2: Sings an enticing song in Otyugh.
results.3-3: Telepathically transmits a message like “Happy good stuff here!” or “Help now! I’m too delicious?”
results.4-4: Telepathically transmits an image of a large gemstone, crooked weapon, or soggy pastry.

results.1-1: Evidence of previous occupants, like bandits, wolves, or dragons.
results.2-2: Heaps of regurgitated pellets studded with coins or other treasure.
results.3-3: A nest with 1d6 owlbear eggs.
results.4-4: Passages through the earth or hollow trees.

results.1-1: Bearing the gear of a hero the pegasus aided.
results.2-2: Offering magical fruit or holy spring water.
results.3-3: Singing a song in Celestial, Druidic, or Sylvan.
results.4-4: Wearing the garb of an ancient heroic order.

results.1-1: The hearts grant an evil wish.
results.2-2: It reverts to its original form.
results.3-3: A new peryton hatches from each heart.
results.4-4: A portal opens to the Lower Planes.

Petrified Basilisk Victims.description: A Basilisk Used Its Gaze to Petrify …

results.1-1: An adventurer with an ornate key hanging around their neck.
results.2-2: Animals like bats, bears, deer, or goats.
results.3-3: A climber clinging to a stalactite.
results.4-4: Itself using a large mirror or shiny surface.
results.5-5: A mimic disguised as a chest full of treasure.
results.6-6: A monster such as an umber hulk or a troglodyte.
results.7-7: Someone caught in a comic pose or making a regrettable face.
results.8-8: A victim now being used as a nest for insects or other vermin.

Planetar Quests.name: Planetar Quests
Planetar Quests.description: The Planetar Entreats a Mortal Hero To …

results.1-1: Convince a villain to meet with the angel.
results.2-2: Find a loved one a villain believes is dead.
results.3-3: Heal the loved one of an evil ruler.
results.4-4: Inspire the defenders of a besieged holy site.
results.5-5: Recover and destroy an evil Artifact.
results.6-6: Reveal the true name of a devil to banish it.

results.1-1: Keeps returning a discarded item.
results.2-2: Leaves footprints on vertical surfaces.
results.3-3: Makes noises like someone trapped in a wall.
results.4-4: Organizes a pack’s contents across the floor.
results.5-5: Playfully puppets a corpse or doll.
results.6-6: Removes bedding while someone sleeps.
results.7-7: Sticks knives or weapons in the ceiling.
results.8-8: Uncannily stacks books, furniture, or utensils.

results.1-1: An ascetic who keeps wicked spirits at bay.
results.2-2: An elder who speaks for the dead.
results.3-3: An exorcist who hunts wicked spirits.
results.4-4: A follower of a god no one has heard of.
results.5-5: A mediator and teacher of traditional ways.
results.6-6: A philosopher devoted to a concept, multiversal view, or plane of existence.
results.7-7: The reincarnation of an ancient faith leader.
results.8-8: A ritualist who uses tinctures and performances to access the divine.
results.9-9: A shaman whose medicines ease many ills.
results.10-10: A zealot who wages war for a divine cause.

results.1-1: Flamboyant accessories it can wear.
results.2-2: Mementos from a lost friend or master.
results.3-3: Outlandish delicacies—like axe beak-egg omelets or mammoth-milk cheese.
results.4-4: The possessions of a sibling, rival, or master.
results.5-5: Shiny gifts, from gems to abalone shells.
results.6-6: Soft bedding and stuffed toys.
results.7-7: A specific cook’s signature dessert.
results.8-8: Time-consuming beauty treatments.
results.9-9: To hear a bedtime story or favorite song.

results.1-1: The burial litter of a lost hero.
results.2-2: A caravan wagon full of trade goods.
results.3-3: A live elephant.
results.4-4: [[/r 1d4#Eggs]]{1d4 eggs} larger than adult humans
results.5-5: Someone marooned in the nest.
results.6-6: A statue of a knight riding a rearing steed.

results.1-1: Areas that trigger traps.
results.2-2: Caverns filled with smoke or gas.
results.3-3: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.xgLA30rErlkjIPAK#dead-magic-zone]{Dead magic}* or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.xgLA30rErlkjIPAK#wild-magic-zone]{wild magic}* zones.
results.4-4: The lair of a creature it is trying to bait out.
results.5-5: A nest of rats, insects, or other vermin.
results.6-6: Patches of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#brown-mold]{brown mold}* or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#green-slime]{green slime}*.
results.7-7: Pools of magma or boiling water.
results.8-8: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#razorvine]{Razorvine}* or similar dangerous plants.

results.1-1: Animal furs, bones, horns, and claws.
results.2-2: Beehives or wasp nests over a wicker frame.
results.3-3: A carved pumpkin atop a body of thick vines.
results.4-4: Nets, flotsam, grapnels, and fishing tackle.
results.5-5: Oversize stuffed animal or mannequin parts.
results.6-6: Rusty armor and torture devices.
results.7-7: A sackcloth head atop straw-stuffed clothes.
results.8-8: Wedding clothes that were never worn.

Sea Hag Disguises.name: Sea Hag Disguises
Sea Hag Disguises.description: The Sea Hag Takes the Form of A …

results.1-1: Captive and claims nearby villagers bound them and left them to drown.
results.2-2: Castaway and shares a cursed item’s location with would-be rescuers.
results.3-3: Healer and passes off poisons as medicine.
results.4-4: Panic-spreading prophesier of doom.
results.5-5: Ship captain and delivers passengers to the hag’s pet sea monster.
results.6-6: Wounded sailor and claims their ship was destroyed by merfolk or other peaceful people.

results.1-1: A distorted stalker that lurks in the woods.
results.2-2: A fiend that dwells near a wicked ritual site.
results.3-3: Grasping hands that haunt a miser’s home.
results.4-4: A grim storybook character that follows those who speak its name.
results.5-5: Its target, acting in eerie pantomime.
results.6-6: An ominous priest that haunts a defiled site.

results.1-1: Covered in vibrant alien or Feywild blooms.
results.2-2: Hauling a rune-etched menhir in its torso.
results.3-3: Infested with vermin or fungi.
results.4-4: Made up of knotty vines entangling skeletons.
results.5-5: Mutated and leaking glowing pollution.
results.6-6: The remains of an ancient tree or a treant.

Skeleton Pantomimes.name: Skeleton Pantomimes
Skeleton Pantomimes.description: Left to Its Own Devices, the Skeleton …

results.1-1: Delivers meal salvers or ages-old correspondence to the crypt of its dead master.
results.2-2: Endlessly trains in battle with other skeletons, despite being hacked to animate splinters.
results.3-3: Mimics ways it entertained itself in life, such as acting, dancing, or reading.
results.4-4: Performs a familiar task, such as cleaning, cooking, mining, or praying.
results.5-5: Repeats its final moments of life.
results.6-6: Stands guard at the post it protected in life.

results.1-1: A community afflicted by curses, grudges, plagues, or tragedies.
results.2-2: An evil Artifact or a deadly magical device.
results.3-3: The place where a villain died or is buried.
results.4-4: The lair of a Fiend or an Undead.
results.5-5: A portal to the Lower Planes, Negative Plane, or Shadowfell.
results.6-6: The sanctuary of a necromancer or death cult.
results.7-7: A secluded monument binding wicked souls.
results.8-8: The site of a disaster or mass death.

results.1-1: Artifacts, their locations, and their owners.
results.2-2: Betrayals by infernal allies or other devils.
results.3-3: Crimes or deceptions by influential leaders.
results.4-4: Prophecies or secrets hidden by gods.
results.5-5: The identities of incognito individuals.
results.6-6: The movements of extraplanar armies.

results.1-1: A character is to blame for its recent failures.
results.2-2: It has been evicted from its rightful home.
results.3-3: Locals have reneged on an age-old bargain.
results.4-4: Other creatures are mocking it.
results.5-5: A rival is spying on it.
results.6-6: Someone’s treasure rightfully belongs to it.

results.1-1: A bard or traveling performer.
results.2-2: A captive or servant of a monster or villain.
results.3-3: A dignitary or traveler from a distant land.
results.4-4: A visitor from a different time or world.

results.1-1: The attic or furniture of a ruined building.
results.2-2: A cave or narrow crevice.
results.3-3: A hollow tree or thicket.
results.4-4: The remains of a gigantic, dead creature.

results.1-1: Allow only those wearing ritual garb to pass.
results.2-2: Cast Slow on and aid in apprehending anyone who touches a city’s prized relic.
results.3-3: Destroy a dam or bridge at the command of one bearing a ruler’s medallion of office.
results.4-4: Obey whoever places a missing crest in its chest, then deactivate for a year.
results.5-5: Reveal a hidden passage to those who recite a leader’s final words.
results.6-6: Watch for and do battle with the type of monster that slew the hero it resembles.

results.1-1: Adopting the form of a lost loved one.
results.2-2: Charming someone close to its target.
results.3-3: Isolating them from their loved ones.
results.4-4: Manipulating events to bring surprise fortune.
results.5-5: Posing as a flattering underling.
results.6-6: Taking the form of one in need of protection.

results.1-1: Evidence of a magic spell reflected back on its caster, like Ice Knife or Melf’s Acid Arrow .
results.2-2: Massive footprints or claw marks.
results.3-3: A shattered mountain or diverted river.
results.4-4: A russet scale the size of a knight’s shield.

results.1-1: Blessed by a god and grows magic fruit.
results.2-2: Growing atop the entrance to a dungeon or portal to the Feywild.
results.3-3: Home to a community of pixies or sprites.
results.4-4: The last lore keeper of lost druidic knowledge.
results.5-5: Rooted on a hero’s burial mound and animates trees that look like questing knights.
results.6-6: Scarred by a fire and holds the bones of the arsonist who started it in a hollow.

results.1-1: Convince cultists their god has forsaken them.
results.2-2: Destabilize a nation and rule the chaos.
results.3-3: Incite a calamity and hold a world hostage.
results.4-4: Provoke hostilities between immortal armies and sell magic weapons to both sides.
results.5-5: Steal an invention and slay all who know of it.
results.6-6: Unleash fiendish hordes on a foe’s homeland.

results.1-1: The breath of an infamous god or monster.
results.2-2: A guardian of a hidden portal or magical site.
results.3-3: The lingering violent thoughts of someone killed in a great battle.
results.4-4: A manifestation of uncontrolled magic.
results.5-5: A servant of an evil elemental ruler such as Yan-C-Bin (the Elemental Prince of Evil Air).
results.6-6: Unable to complete its duty and tries to create circumstances allowing it to fulfill its task.

results.1-1: Among the roots of a dead tree.
results.2-2: At the bottom of a stagnant pool.
results.3-3: A coffin filled with grave dirt.
results.4-4: A large pot full of blood or vinegar.
results.5-5: A space accessible only by shape-shifting.
results.6-6: Within a statue or suit of armor.

results.1-1: A bodyguard who protects a noble.
results.2-2: A cavalry officer with an unusual steed.
results.3-3: A crusader who fights for a divine cause.
results.4-4: A duelist who claims to be unbeatable.
results.5-5: A gate guard who asks nonsensical questions.
results.6-6: A grizzled veteran who trains new recruits.
results.7-7: A hunter skilled at slaying specific monsters.
results.8-8: A retired general who is weary of battle.
results.9-9: A volunteer with a homemade weapon.
results.10-10: A young mercenary trying to prove their skill.

results.1-1: Chilling or near-boiling temperatures.
results.2-2: Energetic effervescence.
results.3-3: Muddy, polluted, or crystal-clear water.
results.4-4: Seaweed, tiny fish, or other sea life.

results.1-1: Legendary weapon or symbol of rulership.
results.2-2: Proving ground for prophesied heroes.
results.3-3: Rare species of magical plant or animal.
results.4-4: Sacred fountain with magical waters.

Wight Motives.name: Wight Motives
Wight Motives.description: The Wight Returned from the Dead To …

results.1-1: Challenge anyone who passes near its grave on a certain cursed night.
results.2-2: Conquer the land it believes it should rule.
results.3-3: Continue the crimes it was executed for.
results.4-4: Follow the foul master it served in life.
results.5-5: Honor an oath it left unfulfilled in life.
results.6-6: Obey the cult or deity that gave it unlife.
results.7-7: Prove it was the greatest warrior to ever live.
results.8-8: Seek its stolen heart or other treasure.

results.1-1: An abandoned structure ready to collapse.
results.2-2: An ambush by hungry ghouls or vampires.
results.3-3: A dreaded ruin that curses those who enter.
results.4-4: The lair of a predator, like a bear or wyvern.
results.5-5: Patches of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#brown-mold]{brown mold}* or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#green-slime]{green slime.}*

results.1-1: The blasphemous magic of a cursed location.
results.2-2: The exorcised evil of a redeemed villain.
results.3-3: A legendary villain who returns once a century.
results.4-4: Locals’ fear of a superstition or legend.
results.5-5: The memory of a tragedy.
results.6-6: A profane idea or foul piece of lore.
results.7-7: The torment of one or more suffering souls.
results.8-8: The viciousness of a profane Artifact.
results.9-9: The vile dreams of a slumbering god.
results.10-10: The voracity of a life-hungry realm, such as the Shadowfell or Negative Plane.

results.1-1: Adamantine or mithral.
results.2-2: Coins minted by a long-dead empire.
results.3-3: Fossils or petrified wood.
results.4-4: A gem that’s part of a magic item.
results.5-5: The keystone of a great arch or bridge.
results.6-6: Parts of a galeb duhr or stone golem.
results.7-7: A piece of a meteor or moon.
results.8-8: The stone crowning a mountain peak.

Yuan-ti Transformations.name: Yuan-ti Transformations
Yuan-ti Transformations.description: A Yuan-ti Gained Its Snake Features From …

results.1-1: Bargaining parts of its soul to a pantheon of serpentine demigods.
results.2-2: A curse laid on its people in the distant past.
results.3-3: The dream-venom of Merrshaulk, a slumbering snake god.
results.4-4: Experiments by spirit nagas or other yuan-ti.
results.5-5: A ritual involving the skin of a fiendish snake.
results.6-6: Trials to excise its “weak” human parts.

results.1-1: Claim a portal with strategic importance.
results.2-2: Enlist monsters as allies or beasts of war.
results.3-3: Destroy a city harboring enemy cultists.
results.4-4: Liberate an imprisoned fiendish ally.
